alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 10:39AM PST until January 31 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTERY WEATHER FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST INTO MONDAY... .Heavier Snow in the mountains and valleys is expected to increase later Sunday with snow persisting into Monday for the mountains. Mixed wintry weather with rain, snow and a little sleet or freezing rain can be expected in the south parts of eastern Washington and Idaho Panhandle. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches valleys and up to 6 inches in the mountains. * WHERE...Eastport, Sandpoint, Colville, Northport, Bonners Ferry, Orin-Rice Road, Athol, Newport, Flowery Trail Road, Chewelah, Deer Park, Springdale-Hunters Road, Kettle Falls, Schweitzer Mountain Road, and Priest River. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 6 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
